thread.title: Ukip leader Paul Nuttall urged to run in Stoke-on-Trent by-election
thread.title_full: Ukip leader Paul Nuttall urged to run in Stoke-on-Trent by-election

author: Ben Glaze
title: Ukip leader Paul Nuttall urged to run in Stoke-on-Trent by-election
text:
Get politics   Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
UKIP leader Paul Nuttall was being urged to contest the Stoke-on-Trent Central by-election. 
The newly-elected party chief could launch a bid to seize the seat from Labour following Tristram Hunt's bombshell resignation. 
UKIP came second in the constituency at the 2015 general election, trailing Labour by 5,179 votes. 
Stoke backed Brexit with 66% of voters opting to Leave at June's referendum. 
UKIP is tipped to capitalise on the decision in the upcoming by-election. 
Party sources confirmed Mr Nuttall was being urged to run. 
He is UKIP's second most high profile politician after Nigel Farage. (Photo: Getty)
